intro: Oxandra guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan oxandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, glossy green foliage. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
